answer:
QUESTION

 

 

It is believed that one should not keep or plant CACTUS Plants at home. This may bring illness or bad fortune. Please kindly advise me how far is it correct if we see in the light of Islam.

 

 

My father is continuously sick and we have cactus plants in our house. Please kindly help me in replying me through email.I would be really greatfull to the Fatwa Team.

 

 

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

The belief that cactus plant brings evil and misfortune to one’s home is incorrect. This has no basis in the Qurān and Hadīth. Therefore, you make keep the cactus plant and not remove it.

 

As far as your father’s sickness concern, you may read YA SALAAMU [1] 131 times and other masnūn athkār for him. Inshā Allāh, Allāh jalla jalāluhu will grant him Shifā’.

 

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum 

Ml. Abdur Rahman Shareef,
Student Dārul Iftā


Checked and Approved by:

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
Dārul Iftā




[1] يا سلام
